query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Quando il settentrïon del primo cielo, 2 che né occaso mai seppe né orto 3 né d’altra nebbia che di colpa velo,
4 e che faceva lì ciascun accorto 5 di suo dover, come ’l più basso face 6 qual temon gira per venire a porto,
7 fermo s’affisse: la gente verace, 8 venuta prima tra ’l grifone ed esso, 9 al carro volse sé come a sua pace;
10 e un di loro, quasi da ciel messo, 11 ‘Veni, sponsa, de Libano’ cantando 12 gridò tre volte, e tutti li altri appresso.
query.result:
**English:**
1 When the north of the first heaven, 2 which never knew setting nor rising, 3 nor any veil of mist except of sin,
4 and which made everyone there aware 5 of his duty, as the lowest light 6 which turns like a rudder to come to port,
7 stood still: the truthful people, 8 who had come first between the griffin and it, 9 turned to the chariot as to their peace;
10 and one of them, as if sent from heaven, 11 singing "Veni, sponsa, de Libano" 12 cried out three times, and all the others after him.
**Malay:**
1 Ketika utara langit pertama, 2 yang tidak pernah tahu terbenam atau terbit, 3 atau selubung kabut apa pun kecuali dosa,
4 dan yang membuat setiap orang di sana menyadari 5 tugasnya, seperti cahaya terendah 6 yang berputar seperti kemudi untuk sampai ke pelabuhan,
7 berdiri diam: orang-orang yang jujur, 8 yang telah datang lebih dulu di antara griffin dan itu, 9 berbalik ke kereta sebagai kedamaian mereka;
10 dan salah satu dari mereka, seolah-olah dikirim dari surga, 11 menyanyikan "Veni, sponsa, de Libano" 12 berteriak tiga kali, dan semua yang lain mengikutinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Quali i beati al novissimo bando 14 surgeran presti ognun di sua caverna, 15 la revestita voce alleluiando,
16 cotali in su la divina basterna 17 si levar cento, ad vocem tanti senis, 18 ministri e messaggier di vita etterna.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Like the blessed at the final summons 14 each will rise quickly from his cave, 15 his resurrected voice singing alleluia,
16 so on the divine litter 17 a hundred rose up, at the voice of such an elder, 18 ministers and messengers of eternal life.
**Malay:**
13 Seperti orang-orang yang diberkati pada panggilan terakhir 14 masing-masing akan bangkit dengan cepat dari guanya, 15 suaranya yang telah dibangkitkan menyanyikan alleluia,
16 demikianlah di atas tandu ilahi 17 seratus orang bangkit, mendengar suara orang tua itu, 18 para pelayan dan pembawa pesan kehidupan kekal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Tutti dicean: ‘Benedictus qui venis!’, 20 e fior gittando e di sopra e dintorno, 21 ‘Manibus, oh, date lilïa plenis!’.
query.result:
**English:**
19 All were saying: ‘Blessed is he who comes!’, 20 and throwing flowers above and around, 21 ‘Oh, give lilies with your hands full!’.
**Malay:**
19 Semua berkata: ‘Selamat datang!’, 20 dan melempar bunga ke atas dan ke sekeliling, 21 ‘Oh, berikan bunga lili dengan tanganmu yang penuh!’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Io vidi già nel cominciar del giorno 23 la parte orïental tutta rosata, 24 e l’altro ciel di bel sereno addorno;
25 e la faccia del sol nascere ombrata, 26 sì che per temperanza di vapori 27 l’occhio la sostenea lunga fïata:
28 così dentro una nuvola di fiori 29 che da le mani angeliche saliva 30 e ricadeva in giù dentro e di fori,
31 sovra candido vel cinta d’uliva 32 donna m’apparve, sotto verde manto 33 vestita di color di fiamma viva.
query.result:
**English:**
22 I saw already at the beginning of the day 23 the eastern part all rosy, 24 and the other sky adorned with beautiful serenity;
25 and the face of the sun rising shaded, 26 so that because of the moderation of vapors 27 the eye could bear it for a long time:
28 thus within a cloud of flowers 29 that rose from angelic hands 30 and fell back down inside and out,
31 over a white veil, crowned with olive, 32 a lady appeared to me, under a green mantle, 33 dressed in the color of a living flame.
**Malay:**
22 Aku telah melihat pada awal hari 23 bagian timur semuanya berwarna merah jambu, 24 dan langit lainnya dihiasi dengan ketenangan yang indah;
25 dan wajah matahari terbit yang teduh, 26 sehingga karena penguapan yang sedang 27 mata dapat menahannya untuk waktu yang lama:
28 demikian di dalam awan bunga-bunga 29 yang naik dari tangan-tangan malaikat 30 dan jatuh kembali ke bawah di dalam dan di luar,
31 di atas kerudung putih, dimahkotai dengan zaitun, 32 seorang wanita muncul kepadaku, di bawah jubah hijau, 33 mengenakan warna api yang hidup.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 E lo spirito mio, che già cotanto 35 tempo era stato ch’a la sua presenza 36 non era di stupor, tremando, affranto,
37 sanza de li occhi aver più conoscenza, 38 per occulta virtù che da lei mosse, 39 d’antico amor sentì la gran potenza.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And my spirit, which had been so long 35 a time that it was not in its presence 36 free from astonishment, trembling, and exhausted,
37 without having any more knowledge of my eyes, 38 through a hidden power that moved from her, 39 felt the great power of ancient love.
**Malay:**
34 Dan rohku, yang telah begitu lama 35 sehingga tidak berada di hadiratnya 36 bebas dari keheranan, gemetar, dan lelah,
37 tanpa memiliki pengetahuan lebih lanjut tentang mataku, 38 melalui kekuatan tersembunyi yang bergerak darinya, 39 merasakan kekuatan besar cinta kuno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Tosto che ne la vista mi percosse 41 l’alta virtù che già m’avea trafitto 42 prima ch’io fuor di püerizia fosse,
43 volsimi a la sinistra col respitto 44 col quale il fantolin corre a la mamma 45 quando ha paura o quando elli è afflitto,
46 per dicere a Virgilio: ‘Men che dramma 47 di sangue m’è rimaso che non tremi: 48 conosco i segni de l’antica fiamma’.
query.result:
**English:**
40 As soon as my sight was struck by 41 the noble spirit who had already pierced me 42 before I was out of childhood,
43 I turned to the left with the respect 44 with which a little child runs to its mother 45 when it is afraid or when it is distressed,
46 to say to Virgil: ‘Less than a dram 47 of blood is left in me that does not tremble: 48 I recognize the signs of the old flame’.
**Malay:**
40 Segera setelah penglihatanku tertuju pada 41 roh mulia yang telah menusukku 42 sebelum aku keluar dari masa kanak-kanak,
43 aku berpaling ke kiri dengan rasa hormat 44 seperti seorang anak kecil berlari kepada ibunya 45 ketika dia takut atau ketika dia menderita,
46 untuk berkata kepada Virgil: ‘Kurang dari satu dram 47 darah yang tersisa dalam diriku yang tidak gemetar: 48 aku mengenali tanda-tanda api lama’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 «Dante, perché Virgilio se ne vada, 56 non pianger anco, non piangere ancora; 57 ché pianger ti conven per altra spada».
query.result:
**English:**
55 "Dante, why do you weep because Virgil departs, 56 do not weep yet, do not weep yet; 57 for it is fitting for you to weep for another sword".
**Malay:**
55 "Dante, mengapa kamu menangis karena Virgil pergi, 56 jangan menangis dulu, jangan menangis lagi; 57 karena pantas bagimu untuk menangis karena pedang yang lain".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Quasi ammiraglio che in poppa e in prora 59 viene a veder la gente che ministra 60 per li altri legni, e a ben far l’incora;
61 in su la sponda del carro sinistra, 62 quando mi volsi al suon del nome mio, 63 che di necessità qui si registra,
64 vidi la donna che pria m’appario 65 velata sotto l’angelica festa, 66 drizzar li occhi ver’ me di qua dal rio.
query.result:
**English:**
58 Like an admiral who on poop and prow 59 comes to see the people who serve 60 on the other ships, and to set the course;
61 on the left side of the chariot, 62 when I turned at the sound of my name, 63 which must be recorded here,
64 I saw the lady who had first appeared to me, 65 veiled beneath angelic joy, 66 turn her eyes toward me from across the stream.
**Malay:**
58 Seperti laksamana yang di buritan dan haluan 59 datang untuk melihat orang-orang yang melayani 60 di kapal-kapal lain, dan untuk mengatur haluan;
61 di sisi kiri kereta, 62 ketika aku menoleh mendengar namaku, 63 yang harus dicatat di sini,
64 aku melihat wanita yang pertama kali menampakkan diri kepadaku, 65 berselubung di bawah kegembiraan malaikat, 66 mengarahkan pandangannya ke arahku dari seberang sungai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Tutto che ’l vel che le scendea di testa, 68 cerchiato de le fronde di Minerva, 69 non la lasciasse parer manifesta,
70 regalmente ne l’atto ancor proterva 71 continüò come colui che dice 72 e ’l più caldo parlar dietro reserva:
73 «Guardaci ben! Ben son, ben son Beatrice.
query.result:
**English:**
67 All that the veil that descended from her head, 68 encircled by the leaves of Minerva, 69 did not let her appear clearly,
70 royally in her demeanor still haughty 71 she continued like one who speaks 72 and reserves the warmest words for last:
73 “Look at us well! I am indeed, I am indeed Beatrice.
**Malay:**
67 Semua yang kerudung yang turun dari kepalanya, 68 dikelilingi oleh dedaunan Minerva, 69 tidak membiarkannya tampak jelas,
70 secara anggun dalam sikapnya yang masih angkuh 71 dia melanjutkan seperti orang yang berbicara 72 dan menyimpan kata-kata yang paling hangat untuk terakhir:
73 “Lihatlah kami dengan baik! Aku memang, aku memang Beatrice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
74 Come degnasti d’accedere al monte? 75 non sapei tu che qui è l’uom felice?».
76 Li occhi mi cadder giù nel chiaro fonte; 77 ma veggendomi in esso, i trassi a l’erba, 78 tanta vergogna mi gravò la fronte.
query.result:
**English:**
74 How were you worthy to climb the mountain? 75 Don't you know that here is where man is happy?".
76 My eyes fell down into the clear spring; 77 but seeing myself in it, I turned them to the grass, 78 so much shame weighed down my brow.
**Malay:**
74 Bagaimana kamu layak untuk mendaki gunung? 75 Tidakkah kamu tahu bahwa di sinilah manusia bahagia?".
76 Mataku terjatuh ke dalam mata air yang jernih; 77 tetapi melihat diriku di dalamnya, aku mengalihkannya ke rumput, 78 begitu banyak rasa malu membebani dahiku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Così la madre al figlio par superba, 80 com’ ella parve a me; perché d’amaro 81 sente il sapor de la pietade acerba.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Thus the mother to the son spoke proudly, 80 as she appeared to me; because the taste of bitter 81 pity she feels is harsh.
**Malay:**
79 Begitulah sang ibu berbicara kepada sang anak dengan angkuh, 80 seperti yang tampak olehku; karena rasa pahit 81 belas kasihan yang getir itu dirasakannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Ella si tacque; e li angeli cantaro 83 di sùbito ‘In te, Domine, speravi’; 84 ma oltre ‘pedes meos’ non passaro.
query.result:
**English:**
82 She was silent; and suddenly the angels sang 83 from above, ‘In te, Domine, speravi’; 84 but they did not go beyond ‘pedes meos’.
**Malay:**
82 Dia terdiam; dan tiba-tiba para malaikat bernyanyi 83 dari atas, ‘In te, Domine, speravi’; 84 tetapi mereka tidak melanjutkan setelah ‘pedes meos’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Ella, pur ferma in su la detta coscia 101 del carro stando, a le sustanze pie 102 volse le sue parole così poscia:
103 «Voi vigilate ne l’etterno die, 104 sì che notte né sonno a voi non fura 105 passo che faccia il secol per sue vie;
106 onde la mia risposta è con più cura 107 che m’intenda colui che di là piagne, 108 perché sia colpa e duol d’una misura.
query.result:
**English:**
100 She, still standing on the said thigh 101 of the chariot, turned her words to the pious substances 102 thus afterward:
103 "You keep watch in the eternal day, 104 so that neither night nor sleep steals from you 105 any step that the world takes on its paths;
106 therefore my answer is with more care 107 so that he who weeps over there may understand me, 108 so that his fault and grief may be of one measure.
**Malay:**
100 Dia, masih berdiri di atas paha yang disebutkan 101 dari kereta itu, mengarahkan kata-katanya kepada zat-zat yang saleh 102 dengan demikian sesudahnya:
103 "Kamu berjaga-jaga di siang hari yang abadi, 104 sehingga malam atau tidur tidak mencuri darimu 105 langkah apa pun yang diambil dunia di jalannya;
106 oleh karena itu jawabanku dengan lebih hati-hati 107 agar dia yang menangis di sana dapat memahamike, 108 sehingga kesalahannya dan kesedihannya dapat menjadi satu ukuran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Non pur per ovra de le rote magne, 110 che drizzan ciascun seme ad alcun fine 111 secondo che le stelle son compagne,
112 ma per larghezza di grazie divine, 113 che sì alti vapori hanno a lor piova, 114 che nostre viste là non van vicine,
115 questi fu tal ne la sua vita nova 116 virtüalmente, ch’ogne abito destro 117 fatto averebbe in lui mirabil prova.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Not only through the influence of the great wheels, 110 which direct every seed to some end, 111 according to the constellations that accompany them,
112 but also through the breadth of divine grace, 113 which rains down such lofty vapors upon them, 114 that our sight cannot reach them,
115 this man was such in his new life 116 virtually, that every good habit 117 would have made a marvelous demonstration in him.
**Malay:**
109 Bukan hanya melalui pengaruh roda-roda besar, 110 yang mengarahkan setiap benih ke suatu tujuan, 111 sesuai dengan konstelasi yang menyertainya,
112 tetapi juga melalui keluasan rahmat ilahi, 113 yang menghujani mereka dengan uap-uap yang begitu tinggi, 114 sehingga pandangan kita tidak dapat mencapainya,
115 orang ini sedemikian rupa dalam kehidupan barunya 116 secara virtual, sehingga setiap kebiasaan baik 117 akan membuat demonstrasi yang luar biasa dalam dirinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Ma tanto più maligno e più silvestro 119 si fa ’l terren col mal seme e non cólto, 120 quant’ elli ha più di buon vigor terrestro.
query.result:
**English:**
118 But the land becomes all the more malignant and wild 119 with the bad seed and not cultivated, 120 as it has more of good earthly vigor.
**Malay:**
118 Tetapi tanah itu menjadi semakin ganas dan liar 119 dengan benih yang buruk dan tidak ditanam, 120 karena ia memiliki lebih banyak kekuatan bumi yang baik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Alcun tempo il sostenni col mio volto: 122 mostrando li occhi giovanetti a lui, 123 meco il menava in dritta parte vòlto.
query.result:
**English:**
121 For some time I sustained him with my face, 122 showing him my youthful eyes, 123 I led him with me, turned toward the right path.
**Malay:**
121 Untuk beberapa waktu aku menenangkannya dengan wajahku, 122 menunjukkan mataku yang muda kepadanya, 123 aku membawanya bersamaku, berbelok ke arah jalan yang benar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Sì tosto come in su la soglia fui 125 di mia seconda etade e mutai vita, 126 questi si tolse a me, e diessi altrui.
query.result:
**English:**
124 As soon as I was on the threshold 125 of my second age and changed my life, 126 this one took himself away from me and gave himself to another.
**Malay:**
124 Segera setelah aku berada di ambang 125 usia keduaku dan mengubah hidupku, 126 orang ini meninggalkan aku dan memberikan dirinya kepada orang lain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Né l’impetrare ispirazion mi valse, 134 con le quali e in sogno e altrimenti 135 lo rivocai: sì poco a lui ne calse!
136 Tanto giù cadde, che tutti argomenti 137 a la salute sua eran già corti, 138 fuor che mostrarli le perdute genti.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Nor did my pleading avail me to inspire him, 134 with which both in dreams and otherwise 135 I recalled him: so little did he care!
136 So low he fell that all arguments 137 for his salvation were already short, 138 except to show him the lost people.
**Malay:**
133 Tidak juga permohonanku mengilhaminya, 134 yang dengannya baik dalam mimpi maupun sebaliknya 135 aku memanggilnya kembali: betapa kecilnya dia peduli!
136 Begitu rendahnya dia jatuh sehingga semua argumen 137 untuk keselamatannya sudah pendek, 138 kecuali untuk menunjukkan kepadanya orang-orang yang hilang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Per questo visitai l’uscio d’i morti, 140 e a colui che l’ha qua sù condotto, 141 li prieghi miei, piangendo, furon porti.
query.result:
**English:**
139 For this reason I visited the gate of the dead, 140 and to the one who led him here above, 141 my prayers, weeping, were carried.
**Malay:**
139 Oleh karena itu aku mengunjungi pintu gerbang kematian, 140 dan kepada orang yang membawanya ke sini di atas, 141 doa-doaku, sambil menangis, disampaikan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Alto fato di Dio sarebbe rotto, 143 se Letè si passasse e tal vivanda 144 fosse gustata sanza alcuno scotto
145 di pentimento che lagrime spanda».
query.result:
**English:**
142 The high decree of God would be broken, 143 if Lethe were crossed and such food 144 were tasted without any penalty
145 of repentance that sheds tears.
**Malay:**
142 Keputusan Tuhan yang agung akan dilanggar, 143 jika Lethe dilewati dan makanan seperti itu 144 dinikmati tanpa hukuman apa pun
145 berupa penyesalan yang meneteskan air mata.
